Detailed Description

The Companion's administration channel management class.

This class handles the Companion's configuration including power management, device update and other miscellaneous configuration.

Method Documentation

- (iBPResult) iBPClosePrinter

Tries to close an already opened printing session.

When no session has already been opened to the Companion's bluetooth printer, this method returns imediately with a success, otherwise it inquires the Companion printer to close the existant one.
If this command succeeds, all subsequent printing commands will fail if no new session is created by calling iBPOpenPrinter.
This call is blocking and has a 15 seconds timeout.

Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPGetPrinterStatus

Gets the printer's status.

This call is blocking and has a timeout of 10 seconds.

Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPOpenPrinter

Tries to open a session to the Companion bluetooth printer.

This call must succeed to be able to send printing commands to the Companion's bluetooth printer. If a session is already opened, this method returns immediately success as a result.
This call is blocking and has a 15 seconds timeout, after which it is deemed to have failed.
When the printing is done, the session should be closed by calling iBPClosePrinter.

Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPPrintBitmap: (UIImage *)  image

Request the print of the bitmap provided as parameter.

This method accepts all image types that are supported by iOS. The UIImage object undergoes is converted to an indexed black and white monochrome bitmap where each pixel is encoded on a bit of data. When printed, the bitmap keeps its original size if it does not exceed the maximum dimensions, otherwise it is scaled to fit within those.
A printing session must already be opened before calling this method, otherwise the call returns immediately with a failure result.
This call is blocking and has a timeout of 30 seconds.
See iBPPrintBitmapSizeAlignment for more drawing options.

Parameters
imageUIImage object to be printed.
Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPPrintBitmap: (UIImage *)  image
lastBitmap: (BOOL)  isLastBitmap 

Request the print of the bitmap provided as parameter.

This method is extended from iBPPrintBitmap and added to fix a print issue that occurs when using a CUSTOM BT printer. More generally you should use this method if the bitmap to be printed is higher than 1024 or if you want to print several bitmaps in a consecutive way. This method accepts all image types that are supported by iOS. The UIImage object undergoes is converted to an indexed black and white monochrome bitmap where each pixel is encoded on a bit of data. When printed, the bitmap keeps its original size if it does not exceed the maximum dimensions, otherwise it is scaled to fit within those.
A printing session must already be opened before calling this method, otherwise the call returns immediately with a failure result.
This call is blocking and has a timeout of 30 seconds.
See iBPPrintBitmapSizeAlignment for more drawing options.

Parameters
imageUIImage object to be printed.
isLastBitmapBOOL specify if the bitmap to print is the last.
Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPPrintBitmap: (UIImage *)  image
size: (CGSize)  bitmapSize
alignment: (UITextAlignment)  alignment 

Print a bitmap and scale it according to the provided CGSize parameter.

This methods works exactly the same as iBPPrintBitmap (It is synchronous and has a 15 seconds timeout), except that the bitmap can be scaled using the bitmapSize argument and can be aligned horizontally (left, center or right alignment). The size of the bitmap can be decreased or increased based on the bitmapSize parameter, and is always limited by the maximum dimensions that a bitmap may have to be printed.
In order to draw the bitmap in its original size, the application may provide a CGSize structure initialized with the bitmap's width and height.

Parameters
imageUIImage object to be printed.
bitmapSizeA CGSize structure that specifies the preferred bitmap size.
alignmentThe alignment of the bitmap within the printed ticket (left, right or center). This may be one of the constants of UITextAlignment
Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPPrintBitmap: (UIImage *)  image
size: (CGSize)  bitmapSize
alignment: (UITextAlignment)  alignment
lastBitmap: (BOOL)  isLastBitmap 

Print a bitmap and scale it according to the provided CGSize parameter.

This method is extended from iBPPrintBitmapSizeAlignment and added to fix a print issue that occurs when using a CUSTOM BT printer. More generally you should use this method if the bitmap to be printed is higher than 1024 or if you want to print several bitmaps in a consecutive way.This methods works exactly the same as iBPPrintBitmapSizeAlignment (It is synchronous and has a 15 seconds timeout), except that the bitmap can be scaled using the bitmapSize argument and can be aligned horizontally (left, center or right alignment). The size of the bitmap can be decreased or increased based on the bitmapSize parameter, and is always limited by the maximum dimensions that a bitmap may have to be printed.
In order to draw the bitmap in its original size, the application may provide a CGSize structure initialized with the bitmap's width and height.

Parameters
imageUIImage object to be printed.
bitmapSizeA CGSize structure that specifies the preferred bitmap size.
alignmentThe alignment of the bitmap within the printed ticket (left, right or center). This may be one of the constants of UITextAlignment
isLastBitmapBOOL specify if the bitmap to print is the last.
Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPPrintLogoWithName: (NSString *)  name

Request the printing of a logo stored inside the Companion.

Logos are bitmaps identified by a name and store inside the Companion either manually (by using the file transfer tool LLT) or programmatically by calling the iBPStoreLogo method. To print a logo, we just refer to the logo's name and provide as an argument to iBPPrintLogo. This call is blocking and has a timeout of 20 seconds.

Parameters
nameThe name of the logo.
Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPPrintText: (NSString *)  text

Request to print the text provided as parameter.

The length of the string to be printed should not exceed 512 characters otherwise the call will fail.
This call is blocking and has a timeout of 15 seconds.

Parameters
textNSString object of the text to be printed. The length of this string must be 512 characters at most.
Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).

- (iBPResult) iBPStoreLogoWithName: (NSString *)  name
andImage: (UIImage *)  logo 

Stores logos to the Companion.

Logos are bitmaps identified by a name composed of 8 characters at most. Logos are also converted to monochrome black and white bitmaps and undergo the same transaformations as for bitmaps printed using iBPPrintBitmap.
This call is blocking and has a timeout of 30 seconds.

Parameters
nameThe name of the logo (Composed of 8 characters at most)
logoUIImage object of the logo to be loaded into the terminal.
Returns
One of the enumerations of eiBPResult. It is iBPResult_OK when the call succeeds.

Provided by category ICAdministration(iBP).
